name: Pork
desc: Pork is meat of the pig

name: Beef
desc: Beef is the culinary name for meat from cattle. Beef can be prepared in various ways; cuts are often used for steak, which can be cooked to varying degrees of doneness, while trimmings are often ground or minced, as found in most hamburgers.

name: Chicken
desc: The chicken (Gallus gallus domesticus) is a domesticated red junglefowl species that is originally from India. They have also partially hybridized with other wild species of junglefowl (the grey junglefowl, Ceylon junglefowl, and green junglefowl).

name: Fish
desc: Fish may include so-called shellfish such as molluscs, crustaceans, and echinoderms; more expansively, seafood covers both fish and other marine life used as food.

name: Duck
desc: Duck is a lean meat filled with protein. It is also comparable in fat and calories to a skinless chicken.

name: Crab
desc: Chilli crab are commonly used and are stir-fried in a semi-thick, sweet and savoury tomato-and-chilli-based sauce.

name: Eggs
desc: The most commonly used bird eggs are those from the chicken, duck, and goose. Smaller eggs, such as quail eggs, are used occasionally as a gourmet ingredient in Western countries. Eggs are a common everyday food in many parts of Asia, such as China and Thailand.

name: Shrimp
desc: Most shrimp are sold frozen and marketed based on their categorization of presentation, grading, colour, and uniformity. Shrimp is high in calcium, iodine and protein but low in food energy.

name: Vegetables
desc: Vegetables are parts of plants that are consumed by humans or other animals as food. The original meaning is still commonly used and is applied to plants collectively to refer to all edible plant matter, including the flowers, fruits, stems, leaves, roots, and seeds.

name: Noodles
desc: Noodles are a type of food made from unleavened dough which is either rolled flat and cut, stretched, or extruded, into long strips or strings. Noodles are a staple food in many cultures (for example, Chinese noodles, Filipino noodles, Indonesian noodles, Japanese noodles, Korean noodles, Vietnamese noodles, and long and medium length Italian pasta) and made into a variety of shapes.

name: Bread
desc: Bread is a staple food prepared from a dough of flour (usually wheat) and water, usually by baking.

name: Rice
desc: Rice (Oryza sativa) is a type of cereal and food

name: Tofu
desc: Tofu is a food prepared by coagulating soy milk and then pressing the resulting curds into solid white blocks of varying softness: silken, soft, firm, extra firm, or super firm. Tofu is also known as bean curd in English.
